# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
using Printf

function wrap_string(str::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
   res = ""
   width = 0
   add_newline = false
   for word in split(str, r"\s+")
      width += length(word)
      if width â‰¤ text_width
         if add_newline
            res *= "\n"
            add_newline = false
         end
         res *= word
         res *= " "
         width += 1
      else
         width = length(word)
         add_newline = true
      end
   end
   return res
end

@printf("%s", wrap_string("This is a very long string that needs to be wrapped to a maximum width of 10 characters per line."))
```
